intro: Psilogramme flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible psilogram, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers bloom in shades of yellow and white. Psilogramme flexuosa is known for its resilience to coastal conditions and is often found in dune environments.
